channel.title: Already logged in? help
channel.description:
Well....I was on a PKing Server (OwnedScape) and i was training on my account (Melongeed) dummies and then i lost connection or something and it logged me out, i tryed to log back in but it said
"Your Account Is Already Logged In Try Again Now, Or Make Another Name" (Quote)
So i made another account and it logged in lost connection and went to login screen i clicked log in again and it said that account was already logged in?
Was I banned for training or something? :confused: please help :confused:

item.title: Already logged in? help
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, because of the insanely crappy way current servers are designed, the main thread is doing the proccessing for every single player. So if the processing for a player throws an unexpected Exception, then the main thread stops, and processing for players stops for ALL players. However, logging in is handled in a different thread, so people can still log in.

The result: people are logging in, but no effort is made to process the connection, so that player loses connection. Now, there is yet ANOTHER thread running: the playerhandler thread. If it detects that player has logged in and hasn’t yet logged out, it will refuse the connection with a “You are already logged in” message. Since processing for each player has stopped by this point, nobody is ever logged off, and it will always continue giving that login error.

So, what causes the unexpected Exception that terminates the main thread in the first place? The answer is using an item on an NPC. The server misinterprets it as attacking a player that doesn’t exist, and the main thread terminates with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, which leads to the events I previously described.

How can you stop the error? Well, for the moment, you can’t, because no source has a server with proper architechture. But soon the CMs will release one, we’re developing a (basic) server that has much more functionality that anything currently available. Note - we won’t be releasing the finished product, but we will let people use it. The IP will change often, and only selected people will get to join.

Read full topic
